I believe this is caused by the absence of a Resolver that handles these URI's.

Please verify that this exists, and reopen if needed

Adding the plugin that has the resolver does not fix the problem.
it still hangs in the same place.

This seems to be an issue with the XML catalog.  I have a plugin which already
caches all the schemas and dtds, yet still the parser tries to load things from
the net.  Here is a stack trace I produced when trying to import an EJB jar file
into WTP.

There is no issue with the XML catalog. The problem in this case is the entity
resolver used by the DOM parser in
org.eclipse.jst.j2ee.internal.xml.GeneralXmlDocumentReader. When creating this
parser, an entity resolver of type
org.eclipse.jst.j2ee.internal.xml.J2EEXmlDtDEntityResolver is created. This
resolver does not use the URI resolver framework. In order to use the XML
catalog, the internet cache, and any other resolver registered with the URI
resolver framework a call must be made to the framework asking it to resolver
the resource.

The calls that are probably of interest are
String logicalLocation = uriResolver.resolve(rid.getBaseSystemId(), id,
rid.getLiteralSystemId());      
String physicalLocation =
uriResolver.resolvePhysicalLocation(rid.getBaseSystemId(), id, location);

I'm not sure if the default resolver is intended to be used and isn't performing
the correct action or if another resolver is expected to be registered with this
parser so the correction may be to add a different resolver.
